name: Truth Serum
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become {@conditions poisoned} for 1 hour. The {@conditions poisoned} creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a {@spells zone of truth} spell.

name: Turquoise
entries: An opaque light blue-green gemstone.

name: Two-Birds Sling
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

When you make a ranged attack with this sling and hit a target, you can cause the ammunition to ricochet toward a second target within 10 feet of the first, and then make a ranged attack against the second target.

name: Two-Person Tent
entries: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

name: Unbreakable Arrow
entries: This arrow can't be broken, except when it is within an {@spells antimagic field}.

name: Universal Solvent
entries: This tube holds milky liquid with a strong alcohol smell. You can use an action to pour the contents of the tube onto a surface within reach. The liquid instantly dissolves up to 1 square foot of adhesive it touches, including {@items sovereign glue}.

name: Verminshroud
entries: This patchy cloak was pieced together from the pelts of rats found feasting on the dead in Blightshore and is dotted with the bloated corpses of magically preserved insects along its seams.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the Verminshroud in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell, you are immune to disease, and you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the cloak increases the range of your darkvision by 60 feet.

As an action, you can use the Verminshroud to cast {@spells polymorph} on yourself, transforming into a {@beastiary giant rat} or {@beastiary rat} while retaining your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as the properties of the cloak. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: While wearing the Verminshroud in its awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to poison damage.
You can use an action to cast the {@spells insect plague} spell (save DC 15) from the Verminshroud, requiring no material components. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.
When you cast the {@spells polymorph} spell using the Verminshroud, you can transform into a {@beastiary giant wasp}.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: While wearing the Verminshroud in its exalted state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Your teeth become razor-sharp natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You can make this attack as a bonus action. When you bite a creature and deal damage to it, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be {@conditions poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.
When you cast the {@spells polymorph} spell using the Verminshroud, you can transform into a {@beastiary giant scorpion}.

name: Veteran's Cane
entries: When you grasp this walking cane and use a bonus action to speak the command word, it transforms into an ordinary longsword and ceases to be magical.

name: Vial
entries: A vial can hold up to 4 ounces of liquid.

name: Vial of Stardust
entries: Any creature that sprinkles the contents of a Vial of Stardust over itself gains the ability to cast the {@spells dream} spell once as an action (spell save DC 15), requiring no components.

name: Viol
entries: Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.

entries.name: History
entries: Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.

entries.name: Performance
entries: Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

entries.name: Compose a Tune
entries: As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.

entries.caption: Musical Instrument
rows: Identify a tune
Improvise a tune

name: Voyager Staff
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic quarterstaff. While you hold it, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls.

This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spells banishment} (4 charges), {@spells blink} (3 charges), {@spells misty step} (2 charges), {@spells passwall} (5 charges), or {@spells teleport} (7 charges).
The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff vanishes forever.

name: Wand of Binding
entries: This wand has 7 charges for the following properties. It regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the wand, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 17): {@spells hold monster} (5 charges) or {@spells hold person} (2 charges).

entries.name: Assisted Escape
entries: While holding the wand, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge and gain advantage on a saving throw you make to avoid being {@conditions paralyzed} or {@conditions restrained}, or you can expend 1 charge and gain advantage on any check you make to escape a grapple.

name: Wand of Conducting
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and create orchestral music by waving it around. The music can be heard out to a range of 60 feet and ends when you stop waving the wand.
The wand regains all expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, a sad tuba sound plays as the wand crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Enemy Detection
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to speak its command word. For the next minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature hostile to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you. The wand can sense the presence of hostile creatures that are ethereal, {@conditions invisible}, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight. The effect ends if you stop holding the wand.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Fear
entries: This wand has 7 charges for the following properties. It regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

entries.name: Command
entries: While holding the wand, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and command another creature to flee or grovel, as with the {@spells command} spell (save DC 15).

entries.name: Cone of Fear
entries: While holding the wand, you can use an action to expend 2 charges, causing the wand's tip to emit a 60-foot cone of amber light. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become {@conditions frightened} of you for 1 minute. While it is {@conditions frightened} in this way, a creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevent it from moving. If it has nowhere it can move, the creature can use the Dodge action. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Wand of Fireballs
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spells fireball} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spells lightning bolt} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Magic Detection
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast the {@spells detect magic} spell from it. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Wand of Magic Missiles
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spells magic missile} spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Orcus
entries: The ghastly Wand of Orcus rarely leaves {@beastiary Orcus|Orcus's} side. The device, as evil as its creator, shares the demon lord's aims to snuff out the lives of all living things and bind the Material Plane in the stasis of undeath. {@beastiary Orcus} allows the wand to slip from his grasp from time to time. When it does, it magically appears wherever its master senses an opportunity to achieve some fell goal.

Made from bones as hard as iron, the wand is topped with a magically enlarged skull that once belonged to a human hero slain by {@beastiary Orcus}. The wand can magically change in size to better conform to the grip of its user. Plants wither, drinks spoil, flesh rots, and vermin thrive in the wand's presence.

Any creature besides {@beastiary Orcus} that tries to attune to the wand must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature takes 10d6 necrotic damage. On a failed save, the creature dies and rises as a {@beastiary zombie}.

In the hands of one who is attuned to it, the wand can be wielded as a magic mace that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The wand deals an extra 2d12 necrotic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The Wand of Orcus has the following random properties:

items: 2 Minor Beneficial Properties
1 Major Beneficial Properties
2 Minor Detrimental Properties
1 Major Detrimental Properties

entries: The detrimental properties of the Wand of Orcus are suppressed while the wand is attuned to {@beastiary Orcus} himself.

entries.name: Protection
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to Armor Class while holding the wand.

entries.name: Spells
entries: The wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action and expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18) from it: {@spells animate dead} (1 charge), {@spells blight} (2 charges), {@spells circle of death} (3 charges), {@spells finger of death} (3 charges), {@spells power word kill} (4 charges), or {@spells speak with dead} (1 charge). The wand regains 1d4 + 3 expended charges daily at dawn.
While attuned to the wand, {@beastiary Orcus} or a follower blessed by him can cast each of the wand's spells using 2 fewer charges (minimum of 0).

entries.name: Call Undead
entries: While you are holding the wand, you can use an action to conjure {@beastiary skeleton} and {@beastiary zombie}, calling forth as many of them as you can divide 500 hit points among, each undead having average hit points. The undead magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of you and obey your commands until they are destroyed or until dawn of the next day, when they collapse into inanimate piles of bones and rotting corpses. Once you use this property of the wand, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

While attuned to the wand, {@beastiary Orcus} can summon any kind of undead, not just skeletons and zombies. The undead don't perish or disappear at dawn the following day, remaining until {@beastiary Orcus} dismisses them.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The Wand of {@beastiary Orcus} is a sentient, chaotic evil item with an Intelligence of 16, a Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The wand communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Abyssal and Common.

entries.name: Personality
entries: The wand's purpose is to help satisfy {@beastiary Orcus|Orcus's} desire to slay everything in the multiverse. The wand is cold, cruel, nihilistic, and bereft of humor. In order to further its master's goals, the wand feigns devotion to its current user and makes grandiose promises that it has no intention of fulfilling, such as vowing to help its user overthrow {@beastiary Orcus}.

entries.name: Destroying the Wand
entries: Destroying the Wand of Orcus requires that it be taken to the Positive Energy Plane by the ancient hero whose skull surmounts it. For this to happen, the long-lost hero must first be restored to life—no easy task, given the fact that {@beastiary Orcus} has imprisoned the hero's soul and keeps it hidden and well guarded.
Bathing the wand in positive energy causes it to crack and explode, but unless the above conditions are met, the wand instantly reforms on {@beastiary Orcus|Orcus's} layer of the Abyss.

name: Wand of Paralysis
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cause a thin blue ray to streak from the tip toward a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@conditions paralyzed} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Polymorph
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spells polymorph} spell (save DC 15) from it.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Pyrotechnics
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and create a harmless burst of multicolored light at a point you can see up to 60 feet away. The burst of light is accompanied by a crackling noise that can be heard up to 300 feet away. The light is as bright as a torch flame but lasts only a second.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand erupts in a harmless pyrotechnic display and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Scowls
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and target a humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or be forced to scowl for 1 minute.
The wand regains all expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand transforms into a {@items wand-of smiles}.

name: Wand of Secrets
entries: The wand has 3 charges. While holding it. you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Wand of Smiles
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and target a humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or be forced to smile for 1 minute.
The wand regains all expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand transforms into a {@items wand of scowls}.

name: Wand of Web
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spells web} spell (save DC 15) from it.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of Wonder
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and choose a target within 120 feet of you. The target can be a creature, an object, or a point in space. Roll d100 and consult the following table to discover what happens.
If the effect causes you to cast a spell from the wand, the spell's save DC is 15. If the spell normally has a range expressed in feet, its range becomes 120 feet if it isn't already.
If an effect covers an area, you must center the spell on and include the target. If an effect has multiple possible subjects, the DM randomly determines which ones are affected.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

rows: You cast {@spells slow}.
You cast {@spells faerie fire}.
You are {@conditions stunned} until the start of your next turn, believing something awesome just happened.
You cast {@spells gust of wind}.
You cast {@spells detect thoughts} on the target you chose. If you didn't target a creature, you instead take 1d6 psychic damage.
You cast {@spells stinking cloud}.
Heavy rain falls in a 60-foot radius centered on the target. The area becomes lightly obscured. The rain falls until the start of your next turn.

An animal appears in the unoccupied space nearest the target. The animal isn't under your control and acts as it normally would. Roll a d100 to determine which animal appears. On a 01-25, a {@beastiary rhinoceros} appears; on a 26-50, an {@beastiary elephant} appears; and on a 51-100, a {@beastiary rat} appears.
You cast {@spells lightning bolt}.
A cloud of 600 oversized butterflies fills a 30-foot radius centered on the target. The area becomes heavily obscured. The butterflies remain for 10 minutes.
You enlarge the target as if you had cast {@spells enlarge/reduce}. If the target can't be affected by that spell or if you didn't target a creature, you become the target.
You cast {@spells darkness}.
Grass grows on the ground in a 60-foot radius centered on the target. If grass is already there, it grows to ten times its normal size and remains overgrown for 1 minute.
An object of the DM 's choice disappears into the Ethereal Plane. The object must be neither worn nor carried, within 120 feet of the target, and no larger than 10 feet in any dimension.
You shrink yourself as if you had cast {@spells enlarge/reduce} on yourself.
You cast {@spells fireball}.
You cast {@spells invisibility} on yourself.

Leaves grow from the target. If you chose a point in space as the target, leaves sprout from the creature nearest to that point. Unless they are picked off, the leaves turn brown and fall off after 24 hours.

A stream of 1d4 × 10 gems, each worth 1 gp, shoots from the wand 's tip in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each gem deals 1 bludgeoning damage, and the total damage of the gems is divided equally among all creatures in the line.

A burst of colorful shimmering light extends from you in a 30-foot radius. You and each creature in the area that can see must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become {@conditions blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The target's skin turns bright blue for 1d10 days. If you chose a point in space, the creature nearest to that point is affected.

If you targeted a creature, it must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. If you didn't target a creature, you become the target and must make the saving throw. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instantly {@conditions petrified}. On any other failed save, the target is {@conditions restrained} and begins to turn to stone. While {@conditions restrained} in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@conditions petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the target is freed by the {@spells greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

name: Waterskin
entries: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

name: Wave
reqAttune: by a creature that worships a god of the sea
entries: Held in the dungeon of White Plume Mountain, this trident is an exquisite weapon engraved with images of waves, shells, and sea creatures. Although you must worship a god of the sea to attune to this weapon, Wave happily accepts new converts.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. If you score a critical hit with it, the target takes extra necrotic damage equal to half its hit point maximum.

The weapon also functions as a {@items trident of fish command} and a {@items weapon of warning}. It can confer the benefit of a {@items cap of water breathing} while you hold it, and you can use it as a {@items cube of force} by choosing the effect, instead of pressing cube sides to select it.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Wave is a sentient weapon of neutral alignment, with an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 10, and a Charisma of 18. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.

The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Aquan. It can also speak with aquatic animals as if using a {@spells speak with animals} spell, using telepathy to involve its wielder in the conversation.

entries.name: Personality
entries: When it grows restless, Wave has a habit of humming tunes that vary from sea chanteys to sacred hymns of the sea gods.

Wave zealously desires to convert mortals to the worship of one or more sea gods, or else to consign the faithless to death. Conflict arises if the wielder fails to further the weapon's objectives in the world. The trident has a nostalgic attachment to the place where it was forged, a desolate island called Thunderforge. A sea god imprisoned a family of storm giants there, and the giants forged Wave in an act of devotion to—or rebellion against—that god.

Wave harbors a secret doubt about its own nature and purpose. For all its devotion to the sea gods, Wave fears that it was intended to bring about a particular sea god's demise. This destiny is something Wave might not be able to avert.

name: Weaver's Tools
entries: Weaver's tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.

entries.name: Components
entries: Weaver's tools include thread, needles, and scraps of cloth. You know how to work a loom, but such equipment is too large to transport.

entries.name: Arcana, History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining cloth objects, including cloaks and robes.

entries.name: Investigation
entries: Using your knowledge of the process of creating cloth objects, you can spot clues and make deductions that others would overlook when you examine tapestries, upholstery, clothing, and other woven items.

entries.name: Repair
entries: As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged cloth object.

entries.name: Craft Clothing
entries: Assuming you have access to sufficient cloth and thread, you can create an outfit for a creature as part of a long rest.

entries.caption: Weaver's Tools
rows: Repurpose cloth
Mend a hole in a piece of cloth
Tailor an outfit

name: Well of Many Worlds
entries: This fine black cloth, soft as silk, is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter.

You can use an action to unfold and place the well of many worlds on a solid surface, whereupon it creates a two-way portal to another world or plane of existence. Each time the item opens a portal, the DM decides where it leads. You can use an action to close an open portal by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Once well of many worlds has opened a portal, it can't do so again for 1d8 hours.

name: Wheel of Stars
entries: While attuned to this device, you have a +1 bonus to Wisdom saving throws, and you can use an action to cast the {@spells dancing lights}, {@spells guidance}, or {@spells message} cantrips.

entries.name: Portent of the Stars
entries: As a reaction when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, you make that creature roll a d10 and add or subtract the number rolled (your choice) from the roll. Once you use this feature of the wheel of stars, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Alter Gravity
entries: As an action, you can cast {@spells fly} on yourself or you can cast {@spells levitate} (save DC 15). Once you use this feature of the wheel of stars, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Part of a Whole
entries: While this component is not installed in the {@items Orrery of the Wanderer}, its magic might function sporadically or with unpredictable side effects, as determined by the DM.

name: Whelm
entries: Whelm is a powerful warhammer forged by dwarves and lost in the dungeon of White Plume Mountain.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. At dawn the day after you first make an attack roll with Whelm, you develop a fear of being outdoors that persists as long as you remain attuned to the weapon. This causes you to have disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks while you can see the daytime sky.

entries.name: Thrown Weapon
entries: Whelm has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged weapon attack using it, the target takes an extra 1d8 bludgeoning damage, or an extra 2d8 bludgeoning damage if the target is a giant. Each time you throw the weapon, it flies back to your hand after the attack. If you don't have a hand free, the weapon lands at your feet.

entries.name: Shock Wave
entries: You can use an action to strike the ground with Whelm and send a shock wave out from the point of impact. Each creature of your choice on the ground within 60 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become {@conditions stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Supernatural Awareness
entries: While you are holding the weapon, it alerts you to the location of any secret or concealed doors within 30 feet of you. In addition, you can use an action to cast {@spells detect evil and good} or {@spells locate object} from the weapon. Once you cast either spell, you can't cast it from the weapon again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Whelm is a sentient lawful neutral weapon with an Intelligence of 15, a Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 15. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Dwarvish. Giant, and Goblin. It shouts battle cries in Dwarvish when used in combat.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Whelm's purpose is to slaughter giants and goblinoids. It also seeks to protect dwarves against all enemies. Conflict arises if the wielder fails to destroy goblins and giants or to protect dwarves. Whelm has ties to the dwarf clan that created it, variously called the Dankil or the Mightyhammer clan. It longs to be returned to that clan. It would do anything to protect those dwarves from harm. The hammer also carries a secret shame. Centuries ago, a dwarf named Ctenmiir wielded it valiantly for a time. But Ctenmiir was turned into a {@beastiary vampire}. His will was strong enough that he bent Whelm to his evil purposes, even killing members of his own clan.

name: Wildroot
entries: Introducing the juice of a wildroot into a {@conditions poisoned} creature's bloodstream (for example, by rubbing it on an open wound) rids the creature of the {@conditions poisoned} condition. Once used in this way, a wildroot loses this property.

name: Will of the Talon
entries: Black, blue, green, red, and white gems carved in the form of dragon heads cover this ostentatious gold war pick, marking it as a weapon channeling the power of Tiamat.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Will of the Talon is a sentient lawful evil weapon with an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 15, and a Charisma of 19. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, and Infernal.

entries.name: Personality
entries: A short-tempered {@beastiary bone devil} named Ashtyrlon lives within Will of the Talon. The weapon is greedy and values strong leadership. It demands that its wielder take decisive action to keep order in high-pressure situations—and to always take a fair share of treasure in return.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The war pick grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Draconic and Infernal.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

As a bonus action while holding the war pick, you can cause the following effect: each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you and is aware of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become {@conditions frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

While holding the war pick, you can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Pick a damage type from the Will of the Talon Breath Weapons table. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a DC 13 saving throw, the type of which is specified in the table. A creature takes 3d6 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: When you use the war pick to unleash a breath weapon of a specific damage type, you can't choose that same damage type again until the next dawn.

rows: Acid
5 ft. wide, 30 ft. long line
Dexterity
Cold
15 ft. cone
Constitution
Fire
15 ft. cone
Dexterity
Lightning
5 ft. wide, 30 ft. long line
Dexterity

15 ft. cone
Constitution

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the war pick reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Breath Weapon property increases to 15, and that property deals 4d6 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Frightful Presence property increases to 15.
While carrying the weapon, you have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the war pick reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Breath Weapon property increases to 17, and that property deals 5d6 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Frightful Presence property increases to 17.

name: Willowshade Oil
entries: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been {@conditions petrified} for less than 1 minute, causing the {@conditions petrified} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.

name: Wind Fan
entries: While holding this fan, you can use an action to cast the {@spells gust of wind} spell (save DC 13) from it. Once used, the fan shouldn't be used again until the next dawn. Each time it is used again before then, it has a cumulative 20% chance of not working and tearing into useless, nonmagical tatters.

name: Windvane
entries: A silver spear, Windvane has dark sapphires on the filigreed surface of its polished head. Held by its shining haft, the weapon feels insubstantial, as if clutching a cool, gently flowing breeze. The spear contains a spark of, the Prince of Evil Air.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which has the finesse weapon property. When you hit with it, the target takes an extra 1d6 lightning damage.

entries.name: Air Mastery
entries: You gain the following benefits while you hold Windvane:

items: You can speak Auran fluently.
You have resistance to lightning damage.
You can cast {@spells dominate monster} (save DC 17) on an {@beastiary air elemental}. Once you have done so, Windvane can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Song of the Four Winds
entries: While inside an air node, you can perform a ritual called the Song of the Four Winds, using Windvane to create a {@items devastation orb of air}. Once you perform the ritual, Windvane can't be used to perform the ritual again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: Windvane makes its wielder mercurial and unreliable. While attuned to the weapon, you gain the following flaw: "I break my vows and plans. Duty and honor mean nothing to me."

name: Winged Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can use the boots to fly for up to 4 hours, all at once or in several shorter flights, each one using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.
The boots regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.

name: Wings of Flying
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can use an action to speak its command word. This turns the cloak into a pair of bat wings or bird wings on your back for 1 hour or until you repeat the command word as an action. The wings give you a flying speed of 60 feet. When they disappear, you can't use them again for 1d12 hours.

name: Woodcarver's Tools
entries: Woodcarver's tools allow you to craft intricate objects from wood, such as wooden tokens or arrows.

entries.name: Components
entries: Woodcarver's tools consist of a knife, a gouge, and a small saw.

entries.name: Arcana, History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when you examine wooden objects, such as figurines or arrows.

entries.name: Nature
entries: Your knowledge of wooden objects gives you some added insight when you examine trees.

entries.name: Repair
entries: As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged wooden object.

entries.name: Craft Arrows
entries: As part of a short rest, you can craft up to five arrows. As part of a long rest, you can craft up to twenty. You must have enough wood on hand to produce them.

entries.caption: Woodcarver's Tools
rows: Craft a small wooden figurine
Carve an intricate pattern in wood

name: Wreath of the Prism
entries: This loop of golden thorns is inset with dozens of gems representing the five colors of Tiamat.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the wreath in its dormant state, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the wreath increases the range of your darkvision by 60 feet.

When you hit a beast, dragon, or monstrosity of challenge rating 5 or lower with an attack, or when you grapple it, you can use the wreath to cast {@spells dominate monster} on the creature (save DC 13). On a successful save, the target is immune to the power of the wreath for 24 hours. On a failure, a shimmering, golden image of the wreath appears as a collar around the target's neck or as a crown on its head (your choice) until it is no longer {@conditions charmed} by the spell. If you use the wreath to charm a second creature, the first spell immediately ends. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@conditions charmed} by you.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Once the Wreath of the Prism reaches an awakened state, it gains the following benefits:

items: You can affect creatures of challenge rating 10 or lower with the wreath.
The save DC of the wreath's spell increases to 15.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once the Wreath of the Prism reaches an exalted state, it gains the following benefits:

items: You can affect creatures of challenge rating 15 or lower with the wreath.
The save DC of the wreath's spell increases to 17.

name: Wukka Nut
entries: These fist-sized nuts grow on wukka trees, which are popular haunts for {@beastiary jaculi}, {@beastiary su-monster|su-monsters}, and {@beastiary zorbo|zorbos}. A wukka nut rattles when shaken, causing its shell to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. This magical light fades after 1 minute, but shaking the nut again causes the light to reappear. If the shell of the nut is cracked open, it loses its magic.

name: Wyrmskull Throne
entries: Built by dwarven gods and entrusted to the rulers of Shanatar, an ancient dwarven empire. The Wyrmskull Throne was a symbol of dwarven power and pride for ages untold. The throne hovers a foot off the ground and is a massive thing made of polished obsidian with oversized feet—the impaled skulls of four ancient blue dragons. Runes glisten in the carved obsidian winking to life with blue energy when the throne's powers are activated.

After the fall of Shanatar, the Wyrmskull Throne fell into the clutches of less honorable creatures. A band of adventurers wrested the throne from the aquatic elf tyrant Gantar Kraok and sold it to the {@beastiary storm giant} Neri for a considerable fortune. Neri had the throne magically enlarged and gave it to her husband, King Hekaton, as a gift, along with one of the Ruling Scepters of Shanatar, which she had found in a wreck at the bottom of the Trackless Sea. Only a creature attuned to a Ruling Scepter and in possession of it can harness the powers of the Wyrmskull Throne, which has become the centerpiece of King Hekaton's throne room in the undersea citadel of Maelstrom. Fear of the throne's power has helped prevent evil giants from challenging or threatening Hekaton's leadership.

Any creature not attuned to a Ruling Scepter who sits on the throne is {@conditions paralyzed} and encased in a magical force field. While encased, the creature can't be touched or moved from the throne. Touching a Ruling Scepter to the force field dispels the field, though the creature remains {@conditions paralyzed} until it is separated from the throne.

Any creature seated on the throne can hear faint Whispers in Draconic—the whisperings of four blue dragons whose skulls adorn the throne. Although powerless, these spirits try to influence the decisions of the throne's master

entries.name: Properties of the Throne
entries: The throne has 9 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. A creature that sits on the throne while attuned to a Ruling Sceptor in its possession can harness the throne's properties, which are as follows:
The throne gains a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover and flies where the creature wills. This property doesn't expend any charges.
Both the throne and the creature sitting on it can move through earth and stone without disturbing the material they move through. This property doesn't expend any charges.

As an action, the creature can expend 1 charge to cast {@spells lightning bolt} (spell save DC 19) from the throne. The spell is cast as though using a 9th-level spell slot and deals 49 (14d6) lightning damage. The bolt discharges from the mouth of one of the throne's blue dragon skulls.
As an action, the creature can expend 2 charges to cast the {@spells globe of invulnerability} spell from the throne. The globe encloses both the creature and the throne.

As an action, the creature can expend 3 charges to create a spectral image of an {@beastiary ancient blue dragon} that surrounds both it and the throne. The spectral dragon lasts for 1 minute. At the end of each of the creature's turns, the spectral dragon makes one bite attack and two claw attacks against targets of the creature's choice. These attacks have the same attack bonus, reach, and damage as an {@beastiary ancient blue dragon|ancient blue dragon's} bite and claw attacks.

entries.name: Destroying the Throne
entries: The Wyrmskull Throne can be destroyed by breaking at least five Ruling Scepters of Shanatar simultaneously on it. This fact has never been recorded or sung of among the dwarves or any bards or storytellers, and it can't be discovered with an ability check. Characters who want to destroy the throne must go on a quest to learn the method for doing so. The throne's destruction triggers an explosion, as shards of obsidian fly out in all directions. Each creature and object within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the throne must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Wyvern Poison
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or {@conditions incapacitated} {@beastiary wyvern}. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Yahcha
entries: A yahcha (pronounced YAH-chah) is a harmless, meaty beetle about the size of a human hand, which feeds on worms and maggots. It moves slowly (walking speed 10 feet) and is easy to catch. A creature with mad monkey fever that eats a raw or cooked yahcha can immediately make a saving throw with advantage against that disease (see "Diseases," page 40),

name: Yellow Sapphire
entries: A transparent fiery yellow or yellow-green gemstone.

name: Zabou
entries: Zabou mushrooms feed on offal and the rotting wood of dead trees. If handled carefully, a zabou can be picked or uprooted without causing it to release its spores. If crushed or struck, a zabou releases its spores in a 10-foot-radius sphere. A zabou can also be hurled up to 30 feet away or dropped like a grenade, releasing its cloud of spores on impact. Any creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be {@conditions poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@conditions poisoned} creature's skin itches for the duration. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Zircon
entries: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone.

name: Livre - Little Red Hood
entries: This looks like a simple red cloak but the size suggests it was made for a child. Inside the hood a magic circle is sewn into the lining with vivid blue thread. The circle is divided into 8 segments, the last of which looks to be sewn with a different pattern. This cloak holds 8 charges, each represented by a segment within the hood of the cloak. Each short rest the cloak regains up to 1 charge, and each long rest the cloak regains up to 7 charges.

entries.name: Over the River
entries: As a bonus action you can expend a charge to cast Misty Step, but instead of a silvery mist you are surrounded by a small flurry of autumn leaves.

entries.name: Through the Woods
entries: As an action if you are in wild unsettled territory, you can expend all 8 charges and choose a plane of existence or teleportation circle on another place of existence (if you know the sigil sequence of that circle) and travel to that location. As you pick the location a small tree with red leaves and pale smooth bark shoots from the ground, rapidly encasing you before you disappear from sight within its foliage. The tree remains where you once were, forever growing in the plane you left.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This cloak never regains the 8th charge by resting, it is only able to regain the unique 8th charge by killing a creature to protect an innocent in danger and dripping the cloak with its blood.

name: Livre - Woodcutter's Axe
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you use this axe to make an attack against a plant (an ordinary plant or a creature with the Plant type) or a wooden object that isn't being worn or carried, the attack deals an extra 2d6 slashing damage on a hit.

name: Livre - Snicker-Snack
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic vorpal sword. In addition, the weapon ignores resistance to slashing damage.
While attuned to Snicker-Snack, you have proficiency with greatswords, and you can use your Charisma modifier instead of your Strength modifier for attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

entries.name: Vorpal
entries: When you use this weapon to attack a creature that has at least one head and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, it doesn't have or need a head, it has legendary actions, or the DM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.

entries.name: Sentient
entries: Snicker-Snack is a sentient, chaotic good greatsword with an Intelligence of 9, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 18. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet. It can speak, read, and understand Common, and its voice sounds silvery and melodic. Snicker-Snack craves the destruction of evil Dragons and urges you to seek out these creatures and slay them.

Snicker-Snack has a fickle personality. It ends its attunement to you if you miss on attack rolls with the weapon three times in a row. Each time you finish a long rest after that happens, you can attempt to regain the sword's trust by making a contested Charisma check against Snicker-Snack. If you win the contest, your attunement to the weapon is instantly restored. Your attunement to the weapon can't be restored in any other way.

name: Livre - Chromatic Rose
entries: The magic roses of the Red Queen's Court come in one of seven colors, as noted in the table. While a rose is held, it gains a harmless visual effect as indicated on the table.

While holding the rose by its stem, you gain resistance to damage of the type associated with the rose's color. If you would take more than 10 damage of this type from a single source (after applying the resistance), the rose disintegrates, and you take no damage instead.

As an action, you can blow the petals from the rose to produce a 20-foot cone of acid, lightning, poisonous gas, fire, or cold, as dictated by the rose's damage type. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 3d10 damage of the appropriate type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Using this property destroys the rose.

name: Snick
entries: Snick is a unique rapier constructed by an assassin guild's tinker. When not in use it appear to be a black leather cylinder, perhaps an oddly shaped case or pet toy. When a button on the cylinder is pressed by an attuned person a deadly sharp rapier telescopes out of the end.

When extended, Snick acts as a +1 rapier. Additionally, if a target is in melee range when you draw your weapon for the first time in each combat, you may choose to use your bonus action to make a melee attack at advantage.

name: Pfennig - Hacrobat's Balance
entries: Because it's so hard for demons to truly die, they spend a large portion of their time thinking about how to make fights look and feel more exciting. For all intents and purposes, this is an ornate gold candelabra that a particularly restive demon has enchanted and outfitted to be used as a polearm and balancing beam.

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon and your attacks deal and extra 1d4 fire damage. While attuned to this weapon you have proficiency in Performance and Acrobatics checks performed during a fight. Additionally, after you hit with an attack you can use some of the residual magic to vault and use up to 20ft of your movement without taking any attacks of opportunity.

name: Denari - Demonchain
entries: The mishapen blade at the end of this weapon makes it almost as much a flail as a whip. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon and your successful attacks do 1d6 damage instead of 1d4.

This wicked chain's lingering connection to the abyss rewards death and punishes celestials. If you incapacitate or kill a creature with this whip you feel invigorated and gain temporary hit points equal to double your CHA bonus. Additionally, if you hit a celestial with an attack that creature takes an additional 2d8 necrotic damage and you gain that many temporary hit points.
Once you attune to this weapon, its normally blistering handle feels cool to the touch.

name: Hot Streak
entries: The monks of the Relentless Dragon practice a martial arts style that emphasizes unstoppable offense as the superior method of fighting. These hand wraps are worn by their finest warriors, manifesting their fiery ki to annihilate their enemies before there can be any retaliation.
While wearing these handwraps, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes. Such attacks are considered magical.

Each time you hit a hostile creature with an unarmed strike, you gain 1 flame charge. When you have 4 flame charges, your attacks deal an extra 1d4 fire damage. You can expend 8 charges to cast burning hands at 2nd level as a bonus action. You lose all charges when you take damage or if your turn ends without attacking a hostile creature.

name: Deck of the Remembrancer
entries: This set of magical flash cards improves a Wizards ability to recall spells.

When preparing your spells for the day, you may prepare one additional spell. In addition, once per day, during a short rest, you can replace one of your prepared spells with another spell of 6th level or lower.

name: Sleeve of Daggers
entries: This item is a small band of navy fabric embroidered with gold inlay. It can be worn under a shirt or light armour (heavier armor will get in the way). It contains a tiny extradimensional space that can store three daggers, but nothing else. It will not be identified without a detect magic spell.
The user can draw a dagger from the sleeve merely by thinking about it, and can choose freely between the three daggers stored in the sleeve.
The sleeve will only exhibit its magical effects if the wearer is wearing light or no armour.

name: Holy Avenger (enchantment)
entries: Holy Avenger items are relics created in ancient times (often for powerful members of religious orders). They are weapons of good and are specially designed to destroy evil and protect allies.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with weapons imbued with this enchantment. When you hit a fiend or an undead, that creature takes an extra 2d10 radiant damage.

While you hold the drawn weapon, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all creatures friendly to you in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you have 17 or more levels in the paladin or cleric class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet.

name: Life Stealing (enchantment)
entries: Life stealing weapons often have a groove or set of divots running down the blade or haft that channel blood and returns vitality to their wielder
When you critically hit a creature with a weapon imbued with this enchantment, that target takes an extra 10 necrotic damage if it isn't a construct or an undead and you gain 10 temporary hit points.

name: Sharp (enchantment)
entries: While many weapons are sharp, those enchanted with Sharpness are honed to a suicidal edge.
When you attack an object with a weapon imbued with this enchantment and hit, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target.

When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 14 slashing damage. Then roll another d20. If you roll a 20, you lop off one of the target's limbs, with the effect of such loss determined by the DM. If the creature has no limb to sever, you lop off a portion of its body instead.

name: Wounding (enchantment)
entries: Wounding weapons are often especially vicious, with designs built to maximize damage done to their targets.
Hit points lost to a Wounding weapon's damage can be regained only through a short or long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack use a weapon imbued with this enchantment, you can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage for each time you've wounded it, and it can then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success.

name: Red Queen's (enchantment)
entries: All of the Red Queen's weapons were created for the court and guards of an insane queen in a far off land and are decorated with motifs of diamonds, hearts, and roses.
A ruby worth 50gp sits in a rose shaped setting on the weapon (usually inset to a pommel, hilt, or handle). If the ruby is removed a new one grows during the following week.
Once per day, a Red Queen's weapon hits a target you may cast Command on that target with the command word 'grovel'.

name: Shadow (enchantment)
entries: Shadowed weapons are forged in, and with, darkness. Their colors are muted and they becomes harder to track when in areas with no light.
While in darkness, treat a Shadow weapon as if it has an additional +1 magical bonus.

name: Mage Slayer (enchantment)
entries: Mage Slyer weapons are usually created by fringe terror groups or by orders dedicated to hunting down and killing wayward magic users. They are imbued with a small amount of <span class='color-abjuration'>abjuration<span> magic that lets them slip past magical defenses.
Mage Slayer weapons ignores AC bonuses from spells like Shield and Mage Armor.

name: Barbed (enchantment)
entries: Barbed weapons are covered in tilted and demented looking spikes, thorns, or edges that cause more damage but also make them harder to weild.
On a successful hit the wielder of a Barbed weapon may choose to do an additional 1d4 peircing damage if they take the same amount themselves.

name: Billowing (enchantment)
entries: Billowing weapons are decorated with sigils of lightning and storms and feel charged with electricity.

On a successful hit a Billowing weapon and stores a charge of electricity. The wielder can expend all charges on a successful hit to deal that much lightning damage to the target. Most Billowing weapons hold around 8 charges.

name: Desperate (enchantment)
entries: Desperate weapons are usually completely normal looking weapon features a lustrous pearl or small diamond built into their hilt or handle.
As an action the wielder of a Desperate weapon may cast {@spells mass healing word} at 4th level. Afterwards the weapon is destroyed.

name: Flametongued (enchantment)
entries: Flametongued weapons are decorated with a flame motif and always feel warm to the touch.

While attuned to a Flametongued weapon you can use a bonus action to speak a command word, causing flames to erupt from the weapon. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the weapon is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

name: Frostfanged (enchantment)
entries: Frostfang weapons are partially constructed from the tooth, claw, or scales of a white dragon or similarly powerful creature that dwells in the cold.
When you hit with an attack using a Frostfang weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 cold damage. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have resistance to fire damage.
In freezing temperatures, the weapon sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
When you draw the weapon, you can extinguish all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you. This property can be used no more than once per hour.

name: Ghost-touched (enchantment)
entries: Ghosttouched weapons are oddly ethereal and feels lighter than they should. They also waver perceptibly when swung about.
Ghost-touched weapons attack targets in the Ethereal Plane and gain an additional +1 magical modifier if they are wielded by a missing limb.

name: Quick (enchantment)
entries: When you make an attack with a weapon embued with this enchantment you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.

name: Sojourner's (enchantment)
entries: A poem, story, or map that describes a long-forgotten treasure that will make this weapon more powerful is etched on its surface.

name: Waterbourne (enchantment)
entries: Waterbourne weapons are usually elegant and decorated with a sea, lake, or wind motifs.
They float on water and grants the wielder advantage on checks to do with Swimming or Sailing.

name: Mariner's (enchantment)
entries: Mariner's armor is decorated with fish and shell motifs and is crafted by pirates, seafaring races, and maritime communities.
It grants swimming speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, whenever you start your turn underwater with 0 hit points, the armor causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface.

name: Arboreal (enchantment)
entries: Arboreal armor is the dappled green over overgrown forests and is decorated with vines, hooks, and bark for climbing and hiding. It's crafted by naturists, forest dwelling races, and jungle communities.
It grants climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, while in a forest you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

name: Adamantine (enchantment)
entries: Adamantine is a magical metal and is one of the hardest substances in existence. It can be crafted into any kind of metal armor. Armor crafted from adamantine will turn critical hits into regular hits.

name: Mithril (enchantment)
entries: Mithril a magical metal that somehow lighter and stronger than steel. Armor made of mithril no longers imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement.

name: Denari - Gold Dragon Fire Whiskey
entries: This drink from a legendary brewing Monastery in Denari smells strongly of pepper and fainly of ash.

After drinking a shot of this drink, make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, smoke pours out of your ears and any time in the next hour you can use an action to exhale fire. Creatures in a 15-foot cone must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If you fail your save after taking the drink, you instead immediately belch fire, take 1d6 fire damage, and do not gain the fire breath action.

name: Denari - Gold Dragon Riot Juice
entries: This 'drink' from a legendary brewing Monastery in Denari is certainly not whiskey, but some do consider it technically potable. Legends say it was originally brewed by a long lost offshoot of mole-like Dwarves discovered in the Veins of the Earth, but there have never been confirmed sightings of such a creature.

After taking a drink of this liqud you must make a DC 18 Consitiution save. On a successful save, you may spend a single hit die to recove health equal to the maximum possible roll of that hit die and when you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. On a failed save you enter a frenzy and use the next 18 seconds attempting to punch who or whatever is standing closest to you.

name: Denari - Gold Dragon Honeyed Whiskey
entries: This drink from a legendary brewing Monastery in Denari is made with honey produced in hives controlled by the Archdruid of Swarms. It is infused with subtle natural magic the confers a very small amount of magical healing.
When you drink a shot of this whiskey you regain 1d4 + 1 hit points.

name: Denari - Gold Dragon Glory Whiskey
entries: This drink from a legendary brewing Monastery in Denari is the most rare, and most fantastic of their products and is created in special small batches on one of the floating battle cubes of Acheron. Drinking a shot of this swirling amber liquid streaked with vibrant red empowers you with some small amout of the Glory competed for in the eternal combats of Acheron.

For 1 hour after you quaff a drink of this potion you are under the effects of the {@spells aid} spell cast at 3rd level and the {@spells bless} spell (no concentration required for either). When the effects wear off if you are not on the plane of Acheron with additional Glory to use, you must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma save or gain 2 levels of exhaustion as you descend into despondancy.
